TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DesignerActionMethodItem extends System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem

Docs.summary: Represents a smart tag panel item that is associated with a method in a class derived from .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem> class represents individual items in a smart tag panel. An item of this type is displayed as an active user interface element, such as a hyperlink, that invokes a programmer-supplied method in a class derived from <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList>. The association between the item and the method is maintained through the value of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.MemberName%2A> property. The method that this item invokes must neither take parameters nor return a value.
Individual panel items are associated together to form a panel by a call to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> objects.
For a full example of implementing smart tags, see [How to: Attach Smart Tags to a Windows Forms Component](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/42cc4a0c-9ab3-47e1-93b8-03b6a6ccf233).
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent/CS/smarttags.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent/VB/smarttags.vb#7)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Category%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> properties to `null`, and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public DesignerActionMethodItem (System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList actionList, string memberName, string displayName, bool includeAsDesignerVerb);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList actionList, string memberName, string displayName, bool includeAsDesignerVerb) cil managed

Docs.param: The that contains the method this item is associated with.
The case-sensitive name of the method in the class derived from to invoke through the panel item.
The panel text for this item.
A flag that specifies whether to also treat the associated method as a designer verb.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with the specified method and display names, and a flag that indicates whether the item should appear in other user interface contexts.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `includeAsDesignerVerb` parameter is set to `true`, then this item is also considered a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb>; therefore, it will be added to the component's design-time shortcut menu. In [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)], a command will also be added to the **Attributes** pane of the Properties window. A list of designer verbs can be accessed through the designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> collection property.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Category%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> properties to `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public DesignerActionMethodItem (System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList actionList, string memberName, string displayName, string category);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList actionList, string memberName, string displayName, string category) cil managed

Docs.param: The that contains the method this item is associated with.
The case-sensitive name of the method in the class derived from to invoke through the panel item.
The panel text for this item.
The case-sensitive used to group similar items on the panel.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with the specified method, display, and category names.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> property to `null` and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property to `false`.
For more information about how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with the specified method, display, and category names, and a flag that indicates whether the item should appear in other user interface contexts.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `includeAsDesignerVerb` parameter is set to `true`, then the item is also considered a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb>; therefore, it will be added to the component's design-time shortcut menu. A list of designer verbs can be accessed through the designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> collection property.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> property to `null`.
For more information on how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.

For more information on how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `includeAsDesignerVerb` parameter is set to `true`, then this item is also considered a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb>; therefore, it will be added to the component's design-time shortcut menu. A list of designer verbs can be accessed through the designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> collection property.
For more information about how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> objects.
For a full example of implementing smart tags, see [How to: Attach Smart Tags to a Windows Forms Component](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/42cc4a0c-9ab3-47e1-93b8-03b6a6ccf233).

Docs.value: if the item is to be used in shortcut menus; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property is set to `true`, then the item is also considered a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb>; therefore, it will be added to the component's design-time shortcut menu. A list of designer verbs can be accessed through the designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> collection property.
The value of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property is set in the constructor for this class.

Docs.summary: Programmatically executes the method associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property is initialized to `true`, the associated method can also be invoked through the corresponding designer verb event.

Docs.exception: The method, named in cannot be found.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string MemberName { get; }
.property instance string MemberName

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the method that this is associated with.
Docs.value: A that contains the name of the associated method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.MemberName%2A> property specifies which property, in the class derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class, that the item should be bound to. When the programmer interacts with the panel item through the user interface (UI), this associated property will be set.
The bound method should neither take parameters nor return a value.
This property is set in the constructor. It is case-sensitive.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.IComponent RelatedComponent { get; set; }
.property instance class System.ComponentModel.IComponent RelatedComponent

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a component that contributes its objects to the current panel.
Docs.value: The contributing component, which should have an associated designer that supplies items.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem.RelatedComponent%2A> property allows another component to lend its smart tag panel items to the current list. For example, a user control might aggregate the items from one of its constituent standard controls.
This property works in conjunction with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.AllowAssociate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
